citeinfo.title: Attributes for NHDPlus Version 2.1 Flowlines for the Conterminous United States: Bankfull Hydraulic Geometry Related to Physiographic Divisions

descript.abstract: This tabular data set contains information on bankfull depth, width and cross-sectional area for each NHDPlus version 2.1 data suite (NHDPlusv2) flowline (Moore and Dewald, 2016) for the conterminous United States. These data were created using regional regression equations outlined in Bieger and others (2015). The equations predict bankfull width, depth and cross-sectional area as a function of drainage area for eight Physiographic Divisions of the conterminous United States (Fenneman, 1946).
descript.purpose: This data set was created by the U.S. Geological Survey's (USGS) National Water-Quality Assessment Project (NAWQA) which is part of the USGS National Water Quality Program (NWQP). This effort was undertaken to estimate the Bankfull Hydraulic Geometry for NHDPlusV2 flowline catchments and upstream river networks to support statistical analysis, map display, and model parameterization.

citeinfo.title: Development and Evaluation of Bankfull Hydraulic Geometry Relationships for the Physiographic Regions of the United States

pubinfo.pubplace: Journal of the American Water Resources Association

citeinfo.title: The Road to NHDPlus-Advancements in Digital Stream Networks and Associated Catchments

attracc.attraccr: Results were quality controlled and assured by randomly selecting a USGS surface water gage, determining the COMID associated with that gage, using the USGS' National Water Inventory System (NWIS) to pull Field Measurement data of channel width, channel area and discharge, and comparing to the results of the regression equations. Results showed the calculated values presented here fall within the range of values found on NWIS.

dataqual.logic: No formal logical accuracy tests were conducted
dataqual.complete: Data set is considered complete for the information presented, as described in the abstract. Users are advised to read the rest of the metadata record carefully for additional details.

horizpa.horizpar: No formal positional accuracy tests were conducted

vertacc.vertaccr: No formal positional accuracy tests were conducted

citeinfo.title: Physiographic provinces of the conterminous U.S.

srcinfo.srccitea: Physiographic provinces of the conterminous U. S.
srcinfo.srccontr: The source data provided information on physiographic provinces.
The source data is the basic hydrologic framework used to process these data.

citeinfo.title: Database of modified routing for NHDPlus version 2.1 flowlines: ENHDPlusV2_us

srcinfo.srccontr: The source data provided routing information for the NHDPlusV2 flow line network.

procstep.procdesc: (1) Created integer field within the physiographic divisions shapefile. Assigned integer representation of each physiographic division (1-8) as follows: DIVISION DIV APPALACHIAN HIGHLANDS-1 ATLANTIC PLAIN-2 INTERIOR HIGHLANDS-3 INTERIOR PLAINS-4 INTERMONTANE PLATEAUS-5 LAURENTIAN UPLAND-6 PACIFIC MOUNTAIN SYSTEM-7 ROCKY MOUNTAIN SYSTEM-8 (2) Converted physiographic divisions shapefile to a 30 meter resolution raster using Polygon to Raster tool assigning the physiographic divisions integer field (Divcode) as the target field. (3) Assigned physiographic divisions to NHDPlusV2 regional catchment rasters using the Combine tool. (4) Converted raster output VATs from Step 3 into dbf files using Table to Table Conversion tool. (5) Transposed dbf files using SAS to calculate the division area in each NHDPlusV2 catchment (cell resolution = 30 meters, multiply each unique DivCode/NHDPlusV2 combination cell count by 900 to calculate area in km2) (6) Calculated percent area of each division per catchment. Most catchments fall in only one division and have a percent area equal to 100%, however catchments falling on the boundaries of divisions will have multiple divisions of less than 100%. (7) Used the dbf files created in Step 6 as input to the SAS NHDPlus network accumulation program (Schwarz and Wieczorek, 2018) to calculate total upstream division percentages and catchment drainage area. (8) Used regression equations cited in Bieger et al (2015) to calculate catchment bankfull width, depth, and cross sectional area. For catchments located in more than one division, each was calculated and multiplied by the weight of that division (as defined by 0 -1; 1 being 100%) and summed. (9) Results were QAQC-ed by randomly picking a USGS surface water gage, determining the COMID associated with that gage, using the USGS' National Water Inventory System (NWIS) to pull Field Measurement data of channel width, channel area and discharge, and comparing to the results of the regression equations. Results showed the calculated values presented here fall within the range of values found on NWIS.

spdoinfo.indspref: Common Identifier Code for each catchment and reach segment (COMID)

enttyp.enttypd: Comma delimited tabular data containing bankfull characteristics of NHDPlus V 2.1 flowlines.

attr.attrdef: Unique ID to relate to each NHDPlus version 2 catchment and flowline.

attrdomv.udom: Unique numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Estimated bankfull width of NHDPlus version 2.1's flowline reach calculated using Bieger 's regression equation (Bieger et al, 2015) -9999 denotes NODATA.
Estimated bankfull depth of NHDPlus version 2.1's flowline reach calculated using Bieger 's regression equation (Bieger et al, 2015) -9999 denotes NODATA.
Estimated bankfull cross sectional area of NHDPlus version 2.1's flowline reach calculated using Bieger 's regression equation (Bieger et al, 2015) -9999 denotes NODATA.
